explanations.A: The perimeter of a shape is the length around the outside. Firstly, we can label the bottom length 8cm, and the left length 5cm, because a rectangle has two pairs of equal sides. Adding clockwise from the top, there is 8+5+8+5=26cm.
explanations.B: The perimeter is the length all the way around the outside, you seem to have only added the two sides labelled. What will the lengths of the bottom and left sides be?
explanations.C: The area would be 40, but we want the perimeter, which is the length around the outside of the shape. Try adding up all of the side lengths.
explanations.D: There is enough information here. Remember that a rectangle has two pairs of equal sides. What does that mean the bottom and left side lengths will be?
